verses.text: These are the miscellaneous instructions of Solomon which the friends of Hezekiah, the King of Judah, wrote out.
parts: These are the miscellaneous instructions of Solomon which the friends of Hezekiah, the King of Judah, wrote out.

headers: Wisdom Begets the Fear of God
The Perils of Sex outside of Marriage
Godliness: Willing to Do God's Will
A Father's Counsel on Wine and Women

author: Solomon was the principal contributor to this collection.
theme: “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom” (9:10). Proverbs is thought to be the foundation for the Beatitudes (Mt 5). In the first nine chapters, the wisdom of God is personified as a companion of God from the beginning and is revealed in the Second Person of the Trinity, Jesus Christ. The personification of wisdom in 8:22–35 is applied to the Theotokos, the Mother of God, in the Church's Divine Liturgy.
